subtitle: A succulent way to barbecue salmon.

method.text: Set the orange rind aside in a small bowl.
Mix the orange juice, oil and wine together and pour over the salmon steaks in a shallow dish. Cover and leave to marinate for at least 1 hour.
Mix the butter, dill, seasoning and lemon juice into the orange rind until well mixed. Spoon the mixture onto a sheet of greaseproof paper. Chill until beginning to firm up.
Shape the firm butter into a sausage shape, re-wrap in the greaseproof paper and chill until needed.

Place the salmon steaks onto a moderately hot barbecue. Brush over half the orange juice mixture. Cook for at least 5 min or until flesh flakes easily. Turn salmon over, brush with more orange juice and cook for another 5 min. Just before serving, top each with a slice of the dill and citrus butter.

title: Dill and citrus basted salmon steaks
